content:
Sorry for the noob question, but is it possible to e.g. reference a collection of simp lemmas say lemma1 lemma2 lemma3 ... as a single identifier (e.g. myLemma) somehow, so I don't have to repeat the long list everywhere? Currently have code which does a lot of
simp only [lemma1, lemma2, lemma3, lemma4, lemma5, ...]
If they are just a chain of equalities, why not write lemma6 : lhs_lemma1 = rhs_lemma5?
@Jireh Loreaux not a chain; rather, in automation, only one of them applies. Think e.g. f A = 0 f B = 1 f C = 2 and want to just write my_tactic <;> simp only [collection]
@Jad Ghalayini You can declare your own simp attributes. https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/blob/master/RELEASES.md#v400-m4-23-march-2022
@Leonardo de Moura ah, so that's what that is. Thanks!
Jad Ghalayini has marked this topic as resolved.
